metadata.title: CVE-2021-25220 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
BIND 9.11.0 -> 9.11.36 9.12.0 -> 9.16.26 9.17.0 -> 9.18.0 BIND SupportedPreview Editions: 9.11.4-S1 -> 9.11.36-S1 9.16.8-S1 -> 9.16.26-S1 Versionsof BIND 9 earlier than those shown - back to 9.1.0, including SupportedPreview Editions - are also believed to be affected but have not beentested as they are EOL. The cache could become poisoned with incorrectrecords leading to queries being made to the wrong servers, which mightalso result in false information being returned to clients.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-25220` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19+esm2
bind9-host - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19+esm2
bind9utils - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19+esm2
dnsutils - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19+esm2
host - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19+esm2
libbind9-140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19+esm2
libdns-export162 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19+esm2
libdns162 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19+esm2
libirs-export141 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19+esm2
libirs141 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19+esm2
libisc-export160 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19+esm2
libisc160 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19+esm2
libisccc-export140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19+esm2
libisccc140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19+esm2
libisccfg-export140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19+esm2
libisccfg140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19+esm2
liblwres141 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19+esm2
lwresd - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: bind9 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.19+esm2').
